website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight frame that delivers the sturdiness you need.
pros: Adjustable rack that can fit numerous bicycle frames
Because this rack mounts directly to the frame, it can handle heavier side loads
Frame consists of aluminum, so it won't add much to the weight of your bike
cons: Claims a 55-pound load limit, which seems high
Won't work with disk brake bikes

customer_reviews.title: No holes to put in the carrier?
customer_reviews.text: No problem. I used stainless rubberized "P" clamp and it is working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: empoy

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recumbent. The seat tube adjustment arms attracted me to this b/c a recumbent seat tube is reverse angle of an upright. Although it's a little tight I was able to get it adjusted to my satisfaction. I don't plan on going on long tours (at this time) so I don't have any panniers as of yet but may in the future. It seems study, paint/coating is nice, all screws fit perfectly. Between the long seat tube arms and 3 locations for the height there's plenty of room for adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Corvair Guru

customer_reviews.title: Best bike racks around
customer_reviews.text: Every bike in my house (2 for me, and each kid) has one of these racks. I love that the bags clip on and clip off easily. I use the commuter trunk bag (stay away from the waterproof trunk bag with the velcro top.. see my review). One son uses the saddle bags, and the other uses just a basket that I 3D printed the clip on mounts for- but any day we can just grab a back click it in and go.. It's easy and works great. Installing the rack is pretty quick and mounts to the frame on some of my bikes and a seat post clamp on the others.. Highly recommend.. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent instructions
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my recumbent tadpole tricycle. It does not have the braised bits you find on a regular upright bicycle. I had to install the front stays to where the headrest is affixed. The problem I ran into was the movable rods on the tack were too long and because of the shallow angle from the headrest to the rack, the rods were hitting the base bars of the rack. Got out my trusty Dremel with a cutoff blade and trimmed off about 11⁄4" from the rod. Fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Zon Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit an older Trek
customer_reviews.text: The directions suck! Seems like a sturdy rack. HOWEVER, the rack does not fit an older Trek. I have a Trek Navigator 300. The bike bolt holes are set much wider apart than what the attachment point on the rack allows for the mounting arms. This rack must be designed for newer bikes. I just bought a rack directly from Trek/Bontrager that is designed to fit these older Treks. Costs more than the Ibera, but at least I know it'll work.
customer_reviews.author: AcL

customer_reviews.title: Nice strong, light aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've had this rack for 3 years now and I've put 1 long tour and plenty of commute miles on it. For the price, you can't beat the value. Pro: Nice strong, light aluminum. Good welds. Fits my bike perfectly. Carries a heavy load no problem. Cons: The side bars makes it a little awkward to mount certain pannier styles, though that's no longer an issue for me as I'm now using Ortlieb bags with adjustable mounting points. The little clip tabs at the bottom have begun to bend from use, but nowhere near breaking so far. I would definitely recommend this rack to anyone on a budget, or just starting out in bike touring/commuting!
customer_reviews.author: m. harrison

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well priced, decent fitting, and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent rack. It's very versatile, sturdy, and inexpensive for the quality. The actual installation was a bit annoying, since it didn't fit my MTB quite right initially, so I had to kind of find a way to get it to fit right, but once I finally did it's the last I've had to think of it. It's remained in excellent condition and looks great on my bike too, and it keeps low to the tire while still leaving space for my fender and some extra clearance. Overall an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ashtin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality rack
customer_reviews.text: Great quality rack. I hate the look of the racks with the bendable flimsy seatstay attachments; these look great and installed fine. Have a 2018 Fuji Jari with disc brakes and this "non-disc" rack is perfectly compatible. If your disc brakes don't sit above the mounting holes there shouldn't be any issues. I did have some issues mounting the rack on the same holes as my fenders due to the screws not being long enough to grab the threads. I luckily had some slightly longer screws from something else handy but keep that in mind if you have fenders as well.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack, light,  easy to install,  very versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic rack at this price. Its light, sturdy, easy to install, and very adjustable. I actually found the bags brand new at a thrift store and they are very useful. I do not have a car at this point, so my bike is my transportation for commuting, shopping and running errands. This rack has been very sturdy for the past few months. Some scratches in the finish, but it gets used hard. Thinly anodized, so not a durable finish, but sufficient for my everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Anigans

customer_reviews.title: Its good
customer_reviews.text: was annoying to assemble. first ride some of the screws fell out and it fell on tire and almost threw me off the bike. had to buy replacement screws at a speciality store to fit it. not heavy but not as light i was hoping for. weighs just as much as my bike itself (Trek2017verve2) plastic orange clips ont he back disappeared when it fell down. would like to get replacement ones but cant find them anywhere. the tail light bracket is limited on what kind of lights you can install on it. it is very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Teagan Stensrud

customer_reviews.title: Not same product as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to what was in the picture of the product I thought I was ordering, cheap bracket for attaching it to the bike, chipped paint on my bike getting it on. Called customer service and left a message 3 days ago no response yet.
customer_reviews.author: Claudine Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good rack for the money. My bike came with a rack but I needed one with horizontal pannier bars so that I could use a trunk bag and not crunch it. This rack will be strong enough for nearly everyone reading this review. Can you carry a passenger on it? No. Can you carry groceries or camping gear? Absolutely. My only complaint is that the adjustable hook eyelet becomes unusable if you have the rack at its highest setting (29er). See pics.
customer_reviews.author: JimPop

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rack at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this same rack on my recumbent trike for commuting for years. Bought this one for my wife and she really likes it. We really like the Pakrak system, quick and easy to mount and dismount the panniers and trunk bags. The rack itself is very sturdy and well designed. It is adjustable to fit a wide variety of frames and now Ibera is including their longer stays with the rack instead of the short ones. Only small complaint is that the stays are still too short for my wife's compact frame bicycle, so the rack tips forward slightly. However, thefit this rack as well and are longer.
customer_reviews.author: Turk182

customer_reviews.title: Quality Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and lightweight. Good quality screws but make sure you tighten then every now and then. Lots of positions for bungee cords. Optional gadgets from the manufacturer like a trunk that snaps onto the rack are available and other manufacturer extras can be secured to the rack. This offers versatility to meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Probst

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Rack Mounted on Cannondale Quick 3 Bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Very well made with clean welds and solid 13/32nds aluminum rod. Measurements on website allowed me to make sure it would fit my bike, which has disc brakes. They make a disc brake version, but my bike had mounting holes on the rear dropouts so I could use this version of the rack. Solid method of attaching to bosses on seat stays as well. Overall a very clean mounting system that seems rock solid. Despite the beefy construction, very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Fit my small framed bike better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is really well-made. I was surprised how well it fit my small 15” frame bicycle. I thought I was going to have to buy an adapter to mount to the seat tube to mount the forward brace, but I had to do was switch the brace bars left and right and run them upside down underneath the rear V brake caliper and surprisingly it worked perfect. Looks much better than those racks that have the bend to fit hardware. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Kehn

customer_reviews.title: Great rack!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. Didn’t quite fit on my American Schwinn on front fork but I made some creative adjustments. . I’m 70 yers old so easy to install. Only one I found that works. Lightweight and strong. Love it! Got some great Saddle bags from Home Depot and I’m all set. Next month the electric eBike kit. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Fay Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Had to do a little finagling to fit on my bike (my bike's fault, not the rack), but it works great! Super lightweight. My only qualm is the bottom bar on the side isn't very low and doesn't have many places to hook something like a bungee cord - too many round edges and no hookable corners. I've made it work, but something like the little knobs on the top bar would be great on the bottom (so hooks don't slide off).
customer_reviews.author: Keegan Adriance

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cannondale Bad Boy commuting
customer_reviews.text: Great rack. Easy to install but solid. Use it for dual bag commuting over 22 miles a day. If you have attachments, you can use this even if you bike has disc brakes. I was concerned about ordering for my Cannondale Bad Boy because everything states that it is not for bikes with disc breaks- it fits perfectly SO LONG AS YOU HAVE the attachment points built into your frame.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Great rack. Garbage hardware.
customer_reviews.text: The rack is really great. The instructions are not terribly helpful, but I would still give it 5 stars, were it not for the hardware. I stripped 3 of the 6 bolts putting it together, which makes it hard to make adjustments. This presents a problem, considering that it is nearly impossible to get something like this right the first time. I don't know if it's just poor quality bolts or if they are a weird size or what, but now I'm gonna have to drill these out and replace them if I ever decide to readjust the rack to make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin B Clark

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Raleigh Venture comfort bike perfectly and included all necessary hardware. There was no hardware for connecting the front attachments to the frame, but I had screws for that on the bike already. I don't plan to buy the associated bags because I already have what I need. My bags fit this better than they fit my old rack. The main reason I wanted this was that I had a seat mounted rack which forced me to raise the seat higher than I liked. I haven't ridden the bike with the Ibera rack installed yet (because the weather has all of a sudden turned COLD), but I see no reason it won't work out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: CindyTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: good bike rack to install baby seat on top
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this rear bike rack to install it on a bike so we could then install a baby seat on top of it and it has worked perfectly well. The rack is very well made and finished, you can adjust the height so it can fit in many bike sizes and designes. It holds up very well. Recommend it for everyone, it has many uses, but for us it worked as a strong base for a baby seat.
customer_reviews.author: LeCabrown

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank and could probably carry one!
customer_reviews.text: This is, without a doubt, the solidest, sturdiest rack I've found. It is nice and wide, compared to others, and sits well on the bike. I'm giving it four stars because I am not totally happy with both ends of the rack having lips, and I believe there should be another inch or two between the two lips. Other than that, this thing carried a 70lb marine battery with no issue, other than being about a half inch too short, the end of one side of the battery was riding up on the lip towards the front of the bike, but no issues, and like I said, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin Skydancer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fit, finish and strong!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Specialized Sirrus Sport and it fits a feels like it is part of the frame. Very sturdy and high quality. I will recommend this any day.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Works great on folding bikes!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these for our Zizzo Liberte folding bikes. The bikes have 20" wheels, which posed no problems at all in installing the racks. These racks are well-built, sturdy, and well-priced. Great value! The included instructions are CONFUSING and no help at all, especially to newbies. Installation was really easy after I searched for online videos. Love these so much, we've recommended them to two other friends, and we're about to purchase the trunk that clips on. For our other bike, we use a Sunlite QR basket–the spring-mounted clamps attach seamlessly, creating a steady ride for our 10lb pup.
customer_reviews.author: nydreaming

customer_reviews.title: Digging this brand
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying more and more ibera parts. They're really a quite a bit above the "generics" and a lot cheaper than the high end. This rack goes on easy and is probably stronger than the frame. Its my third and if I needed a new one (for a new bike, its not going to break) I'd probably chose it again.
customer_reviews.author: B-row

customer_reviews.title: Not really plug and play -- LOL!
customer_reviews.text: I really had a challenge mounting this rack to my 7300 Trek. The two rods that attach to the bike (that are part of the bike rack) below the seat did not fit. The throat where the seat stem fits into on my bike is about 1 inch in diameter. It appears this rack needs a 1 1/2 inch diameter mount. I bought longer screws and used 1/2 spacers on both sides. Works great now -- looks so-so, but it's OK. I assume the issue with the width my Trek is 13 years old!
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Strong and good looking.
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived on time and in good shape. The rack was easy to install. It seems very strong and looks natural on my bike. I have an older Raliegh Mountain bike. I attached two strong wire baskets to the sides, and carry groceries in the baskets. I have accidently dropped my bike on them, and saw no flex from the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rack.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this bad boy, and am SUPER impressed! Solid construction, easy to install, fits my Roswheel trunk bag and Ortlieb panniers like a dream (the lower bar for the panniers was my main reason for purchasing this, as I couldn't combine the trunk and panniers with my old single-level rack). Loads of options for either my bags or for bungee-cording things to it, hanging my lock setup off of while riding, etc. No indication that this thing is going to be flimsy, and lined up great with the pre-drilled holes on my frame (Specialized size L touring bike). Time will tell, but this is one legit rock solid rack that I can't wait to cart home some groceries with!
customer_reviews.author: A Baumgart

customer_reviews.title: One Rockin' Rack!
customer_reviews.text: The rack works perfectly! I bought it with the panniers to use for my touring bike, and it all works together nicely. I was impressed with the overall design. The mounting system is good, but since my bike was old, I had some issues attaching it. My screw holes were stripped, so I got some bolts and bolted it together. If you do not have holes tapped by your brakes, like me, you can use cable clamps to hold it in place. No big deal. Seriously, the system cannot be beat. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Knight H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Minor mounting hick-up.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product and I would have given it five stars. However, the mounting hardware provided is not entirely universal with all bike models. I had to purchase my own hardware at a local hardware store and customize the front mount / (drilled holes in my bike) to accommodate the mount. It is quite sturdy and makes zero vibration noises. I would recommend this item to anyone that is interested. Just keep in mind, you might want to customize the mounting options for a stronger hold. Amazing item, only one mounting hick-up and that could have been strictly due to the bike model I installed it on (GMC Denali Road Bike 700c).
customer_reviews.author: James Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Solid, not overweight
customer_reviews.text: Seems quite nice and solid. However, do spend a couple of extra bucks at the hardware store and get some decent stainless bolts: you'll be happier in the long run. (I mean, I have a rack that's been on five different bikes and lasted for more than 100,000 miles. You'll want stainless steel bolts. And anti-seize compound. Trust me.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Freaking Amazing Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this bike rack. The modular bags and trunk that go with it are amazing. I ride my bike around town a lot and backpacks make my back sweaty. This rack and the bags fixes that. They attach so solidly I barely notice they are there. No slipping around like my old panniers and rack. This rack also works great for other stuff too.
customer_reviews.author: Verna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rack, Terrible Instructions
customer_reviews.text: The rack is excellent, but the instructions are terrible so getting it onto my bike took an hour and a half to two hours. I finally realized the instructions were useless and after approaching installation as a puzzle to be solved on my own, I was able to install it. So the rack is great, and I know a handyman cd probably install it easily, but for the rest of us, there's no excuse for terrible instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Sensible buy for a light rider
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth getting. Lightweight and solid. VERY easy to install. Their clip on panniers are a great addition and adjustable. The bike I installed them on is a mid 90's Specialized Rock Hopper. I also have fenders and it worked well together. No problems. I don't know how compatible it would be with other panniers though. As far as durabilty over time, obviously, not sure yet, but has good material and construction. My usage will be for leisure riding and not everyday day hauling. For the price, to me it made more sense than buying other brands that are higher priced.
customer_reviews.author: interstellar audio network

customer_reviews.title: Electra Men's Cruiser 1 (with fenders) compatibility...
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect! Very lightweight, I mean VERY! Sturdy, well-built and seems quite reliable and durable! If you don't have fenders, than you're golden! Easy enough to put the whole thing together and set it up on your bike. Just a heads-up, it does NOT come with any mounting brackets and whatnot, so go ahead and order whatever fits you bike (frame hardware pack, seat post clamps etc.). Although, if you DO have a fender over your rear wheel - that might be a cumbersome task to accomplish! In my case (Electra Men's Cruiser 1), rods of the fender and the Ibera PakRak Bicycle Touring Carrier Plus+... got crossed and overlapped!!! I'm not exactly happy about that!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rack and great price
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better racks I've delt with and certainly one of the best looking. The matte powdercoat finish is a nice touch and the rack itself is very strong while also fully adjustable to suit your bike. If you're worried about the little orange bits, fear not. They are just plastic clips and can be easily removed/replaced if you was a fully black aesthetic. The shape works very well with the panniers I've tried and at times I've just tied my messenger bag to the side without any trouble. A++
customer_reviews.author: algarci2

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yes, works with most side bags, no
customer_reviews.text: Yes it is sturdy, but no it wouldn’t fit my existing paniers (side bags). The rods running lower along the sides stick out further to the side than the rods along the top edge. It appears to me this is designed for a specific model of side bag, not one you might already have. My bags, which I’ve used successfully for years, have kept popping off the top rail, and I’ve decided to replace this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and strong.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy bike rack. It went on a Giant mountain bike like it was made just for that bike. Very simple install. I installed two different racks on Schwinn bikes and they took some effort in terms of mounting brackets and such. If you have a bike with screw holes in the seat stays like most decent bikes this rack is probably as easy as it gets. Some big box store bikes don't have those mounting holes so you have to use brackets (usually included with bike racks) but it is more cumbersome and not quite as quickly and easily installed. Installing this one on this bike was literally a 5 minute job. It is level and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for daily use or longer distances
customer_reviews.text: Originally I was going to purchase the Ibera bike bags to go along with this but ended up making my own. The rack is sturdy and has a lot of places that you can tailor a bag to secure it. I had two panniers as well as camping equipment strapped to the top. The rack didn't wobble, come loose or show any problems on the 80+ mile trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kimmy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack! What model is it? Please!
customer_reviews.text: Great rack! Incredible strength for the weight. However, WHAT MODEL IS THIS RACK? I and others bought the wrong paniers for this model. Paniers tell what rack models that they are compatible with, but you can't determine the rack model from it's description! Incredible oversight. Iberia racks and paniers are incredible quality. Please represent them properly, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: LocalGuyTX

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured it out
customer_reviews.text: I had some difficulties to assemble this. The instructions were not very clear and even though I am usually very good with putting things together and repairing I had a few attempts before i was able to figure it out. Once its in place though, its a great addition to my commuter bicycle, very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia ;D

customer_reviews.title: Serious rack, best I've owned, tour quality.
customer_reviews.text: Clean tight welds. Great spacing of anchor points. Exceptional balance of center of gravity. Reminds me of older Blackburn or Old Man Mountain. Not quite custom quality but way beyond any other I've own. Planning on two more...at this price @ $26 3/2015, its easier to have one for each bike than to change rack for season / task change. Well designed, reminds me design and quality of early eighty European's. Every bag system I own fits to one of the mounting points available on rack. Even has light / reflector mount on rear. I'm not usually so easy to mpress. Best design in 30 years that I've owned on my budget. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kneelzsteex

customer_reviews.title: The build quality seems really good and its held up well
customer_reviews.text: The build quality seems really good and its held up well. My issue was with installation. While it did eventually fit my bike I had to swap and reverse the arms that connect under the bike seat which took me a while to figure out. It was the only configuration that would actually allow for the arms to touch where they are screwed in. I do wish there was more places to hook things as I carry a gym bag that I secure with bungee cords. I've been using it for about 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Ribao

customer_reviews.title: Great rack
customer_reviews.text: Installed this rack on my Terra trike Rover. Wasn't sure if I was going to have any issues since it's not a standard bike, but was easy to install and clear directions. I'm using the rack to pull a weehoo carrier for my child and I was able to put a seat post without seat upside down to the two middle bars of the rack to put on the weehoo
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sieth

customer_reviews.title: Love this rack
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack. It's solid and sturdy and works well for my saddle bags. I have taken to commuter biking a lot more for shopping and back and forth to work so this rack has come in handy. The only challenge I had was mounting the part that connects to the the seat post tube but, that is only because I have an unusual frame that doesn't come with pre drilled mounting holes. The problem was easily solved by using a bracket with a quick release pin assembly. Overall, a sturdy and solid rack I would recommend to anyone carrying anything from light loads moderately heavy loads.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Ash

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Had to Jerry-rig to my bike since my bike didn't have the proper mounting holes, but that is my bike's problem, not the rack's. Having addressed that issue, this rack is now an indispensable option on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works well with Ibera bags, with easy push button releases. Only oddity is the place for a rear light... Can't find lights that match the mounting included here. I just put reflective tape over it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: If you have disk breaks....
customer_reviews.text: ...look at the 5, it has spacers due to the construction of the connection point. Having said that, i have this one, the 4, because im leaving for a long trip tomorrow. I have a Fugi and this one fits, but the deck isnt perfectly flat. Im bungi cording a bag to it so it doesnt matter. In the long run ill make a couple spacers and make it work better. The problem is that the mounting tubes wont go straight verticle so it ends up tilted. So, it works on mine, but results will very. Btw, i have 700x40 tires, not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hiestand

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built, reaches further over the rear wheel than a lot of racks.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made piece of equipment. Simple mounting (assuming you have the mounts already), took about 15 minutes with just an Allen key. Nice finish and I could probably stand on it. The length carries it quite a ways out over the rear wheel (24") making it difficult to walk down stairs on the back wheel i.e. on public transit. It's doable, but awkward. Quite pleased besides.
customer_reviews.author: HST4Prez

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for maybe a year and it's been great..
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for maybe a year and it's been great... HOWEVER... The screw heads on BOTH sides snapped instantly when trying to remove this from my bike's seat post frame area. I wanted to do some quick maintenance but had to spend much more time trying to get the broken screws out. Since they were so crappy and soft, my vice grip could never get a firm hold on it. In the end I had to leave them in and drill new holes. Unbelievable how cheap the screws are. Rack has been great.
customer_reviews.author: cmiller

customer_reviews.title: Great rack, Easy to Install, good quality, love the pannier bags that snap on from Ibera
customer_reviews.text: Great rack, I have it on my Specialized Sirrus. It fits great, there is plenty of clearance behind the rack. I have big feet and I never hit the rack or the Pannier bags with my heal. That can sometimes be an issue. The install was super easy, it took me about 20 minutes or less to get the rack on and secured, it fits nice and tight, and I had no problem getting the rack level. I use the rack with the Ibera Bicycle Clip-on Quick-Release Panniers. The system works really super well together. I am very impressed with how well the bags and rack work together as an integrated system.
customer_reviews.author: BV Cody Dog

customer_reviews.title: I like this rack
customer_reviews.text: I like this rack, but it was really hard to get it installed on my bike. I had to adjust one arm inside my back brake and one outside, with each arm at a slightly different angle to get it up straight and the poles positioned on my bike. Its sturdy and works for what I need. I wish the instructions were a little more clear with alternative mounting options listed. I had to search for a few videos and figure it out myself.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit our bike.
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted this to work, and even brought to a bike shop to install it. But the rack somehow interfered with the gears or brakes - forgot which -- and we couldn't use it. We ended up going into the bike shop and having them install one of there's. So the description that it " fits most 26-Inch and 700c frames" is not really accurate. The manufacturer should look into situations that don't work out.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ibera's PacRac system should be an industry standard
customer_reviews.text: I love Ibera's PacRac system. So much so, that I'm a repeat customer. I sold off two rear racks that were NOT Ibera. I have now purchased four rear racks from Ibera that are all PacRac compatible. I have an Ibera PacRac trunk that I love and will likely replace before RAGBRAI 2017 because after 6,000+ miles it's fairly worn. I've got two Ibera PacRac panniers that have been great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Larry P. Price

customer_reviews.title: Nice parts... but needs threadlock
customer_reviews.text: I've lost two bolts off this thing so far from riding. If you use this for an extended period of time, you need to put a threadlocker on because the bolts don't hold well.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Great product + customer service
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bike rack, and great customer service. I neglected to tighten one of the bolts and it fell off along with the part the bolt screws into. Contacted customer service and they sent me new parts, no questions asked, and were super friendly in the process. Didn't charge me anything even though likely my fault. I want to buy more Ibera products in the future!
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: The very best rack! Built to last!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a manufactured product that is made to be very sturdy. I was very impressed with this rack. It did take a little time to install but that was to be expected. I've put more weight on this than they probably recommend but it holds up very well. Thank you for a great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike rack. Great first impression.
customer_reviews.text: The rack was just in a bag in the box which was a little concerning but after taking it out and installing it, it seems like a pretty good product. It installed pretty nicely on my Trek 3500 but it took a little fine tuning on the down tube attachments. I like the matte black look. Looks good on a mountain bike. I haven't loaded it with any weight yet. I plan to get the quick attach bag soon, so I'll update my review after I've put some miles on it.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Happy but not happy
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the product but I am not happy that one of the screw heads broke off in my bike frame. Now I am forced to use a screw extractor to try and remove the broken screw.
customer_reviews.author: Ed C.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is solid.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid. I've got several different racks on different family members bikes. I wish I'd bough this rack for all of our bikes. For most of our bikes, I bought this one:  . The Schwinn model is cheaper by $10, but the Ibera is way more solid with a much greater weigh capacity. If you're doing saddle bag type panniers and plan to fill them with anything heavy, go with Ibera.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: A definite bargain and well made and sturdy rack
customer_reviews.text: When I first opened the box, I thought it would not fit my bike. Once I looked at it and dry fitted, I could not have been more wrong. The adjustment points were super obvious and the mounts aligned perfectly with my Giant hybrid. Although the maximum rating is stickered at 55 pounds, I have no doubt that the rack (with four very sturdy mount points) could easily hold more. I would definitely recommend this rack for its ease of installation and sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Buchbaum

customer_reviews.title: Like many other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews, I found the bolts of poor quality - soft metal and easily stripped. Went to local bike shop for four bolts. It looks good and quality seems good. I hope I'm not one who experiences metal failure at the lower "V" joint. I found the two forward extending arms to the frame (attached below the seat) required additional bushings to widen the gap between the bars as they went back to the rack, otherwise the hit and would not go straight back.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Works but not ideal. Needs more adjustment options
customer_reviews.text: So on an XS cruiser this inexplicably does not have enough adjustment. The bike is a standard Liv women’s cruiser. The forward arms do not have enough length and the axle mounts need one more hole to shorten. Works but not ideal. No other options so...
customer_reviews.author: PKj

customer_reviews.title: Good and NOT easy to install, not flexible to adapt rear rack for bikes
customer_reviews.text: CAREFULL with the assembly, instructions are poor explained and the parts that connect the rack with the back seat bolts, will not fit perfectly, this was not cleat to me, it is not easy to center and you have to play/tune the best position to leave it nice and tight. it works, looks sturdy but, had a bad time installing it
customer_reviews.author: Christian Gutiérrez

customer_reviews.title: excellent bicycle rack
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed at the construction of this bicycle rack. installation was a snap I only have to buy a P clamp from my local hardware store in order to attach the rack to the post. upon installation I sat on the rack just to perform a test to see if they were able to handle the weight and no problems were found, of course It was only a one time test but I was very impressed nevertheless. I ran my backpack attached to it with bungee cords but I plan on getting one of their pack rack bags most likely the 17 ltr one that attaches via built-in clips on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Valero

customer_reviews.title: Is not compatible with panniers IB-BA8
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rack as a set with Bike Panniers IB-BA8 , because a) Amazon recommended them as purchased together and b) the descriptions of both products claimed that they were compatible. However, that's not the case. The top side of the bags, i.e. the piece that connects them together, is too narrow for the rack. As a result, the bags don't fit on this rack, and I had to return them and now have to look for something else. Other than that, the rack seems ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to come with longer screws to attach the rack to the wheel mount. Mine did not. I ordered a second one hoping to replace the missing pieces and the second rack came with incomplete parts as well. I'm returning one for now and going to the hardware store to see if I can find something that works. Otherwise, they'll get the second one back too. Otherwise, I really like the product and would really like to use it, but coming incomplete TWICE is f***ed up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works pretty well. This rack fit easily on my 700 ...
customer_reviews.text: Using the Ibera system, works pretty well. This rack fit easily on my 700 c w/20 inch upright hybrid. Plenty of adjustment, level, low deck height which I prefer. Has some little plastic snap-on rings that don't seem to do much and tend to fall off. Not really a functional issue. Seems plenty sturdy for what I tend to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pippin

customer_reviews.title: Good Rack
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult to install, and my bike required P clamps to attach it to the frame. I like it though, and works good with my panniers and to hold my lock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: yet somehow carried out its duty missing a pretty important load bearing component
customer_reviews.text: Would probably be a 4-5 star review, but for the rack failing with about a 30 lbs load. The circled components apparently fell off at some point early in a recent ride, and the whole rack just fell backwards onto rear tire. On return ride, I affixed same load onto rack, with only one side of the horizontal poles secured, rode more slowly and surprisingly the rack held up. In short, this thing failed me when fully constructed, yet somehow carried out its duty missing a pretty important load bearing component. Would be happy to revisit this review if Ibera or Amazon sent me a replacement components (circled in red on attachment).
customer_reviews.author: Handsome Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Easy fit,
customer_reviews.text: This rack is awesome and is a cheap alternative. I have been using it for mobile first aid while working as a paramedic for about 4 months now. After reading reviews about issues securing the upper portion I was ready when I discovered no uppr mounting wholes on my frame. I used rubber insulated clamps to secure the rack, which was a 1.99 fix. Because of the weight of my medical gear I added permanent S hooks to make it easier securing my med bags (as seen in the pictures) and to aid in the outward rotation of the hook I placed a relief bend in the securing plate. I have recommended this rack to a lot of people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great strong rack that doesn't sway under heavier loads
customer_reviews.text: Great strong rack that doesn't sway under heavier loads. Easy installation and came with all of the parts needed. I do not use the Ibera PakRak bags but instead have Ortlieb panniers. Not that I have anything against the PakRak accessories, it's just that I've had the Ortlieb panniers forever and I'm used to those - and they work well on this rack. Currently attached to my '15 Diamondback Haanjo commuter. Thanks to the seller for the quick ship.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.H.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure all parts are sent!! take a little pride in what you do!
customer_reviews.text: This came missin 4 bolts, that is the most annoying to me, alot smaller than i thought, seems fragile..after i buy the bolts, ill rewrite this..maybe change my opinion, I cant see why they cant get it right
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE D.

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a rack with a lower mounting rail for my panniers. This Ibera is unmatched in terms of quality vs price. Mounting was quick and secure. My only criticism is the mounting leg doesn't allow the carrier to mount as low as I would prefer on a 26" wheel frame. An additional threaded hole in the leg 1/2 " lower would have made this a 5 star review. Regardless, this is an excellent rack
customer_reviews.author: R. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Great basic rack that can take sme abuse and still do whats made  to do.
customer_reviews.text: Good strong rack, better then I expected. It has lots of options as far hanging and hooking whatever to it. I have carried 50 to 60 pounds over some bumpy roads and trails no issue. Make sure before you buy this your bike is rack friendly though, Its not a universal fit. The rack is made for bikes with rack ready frames. I do believe that tire size would not be an issue, I have it on a bike with a 700c wheel set. I am sure it will fit on my 26 inch or 29er bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph h wells

customer_reviews.title: Strong, well-made, rust-free, lots of places for bungee cords
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little rack. Although it's designed for the manufacturer's add-on equipment, it's great on its own with some bungee cords and whatever you want to attach. The mounting points are strong, and it all goes together easily. I expect it to last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Griscom

customer_reviews.title: well this is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: well this is disappointing I really wanted to like this it seems otherwise well made but when I went to attach it the the bolts that are meant to attach the near the rear wheel kept popping out I don't know if the bolts are too thin or if the holes are somehow just stripped to hell but now I have to try my luck with the universal models.
customer_reviews.author: Adam.B

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for the price. It's fully adjust able in order to fit most bikes. Although it didn't come with any installation instructions, it's a pretty simple process. The only complain is the small screws that come with the rack to hold it to the frame at the rear axle were not the right size for my bike. I guess the size it comes with is the most common size but, since there are other sizes, it would be nice for them to supply a pair of screws for other sizes as well. I just found a couple of screws in my workshop that did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Shoff-STL

customer_reviews.title: works great to mount an eBike battery.  very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this rack to mount a eBike battery. The battery came in a bag that attached to the bike frame with Velcro straps which didn't look nice and sometimes got in the way when pedaling. The bike rack is very sturdy and looks really nice. My husband who is quite mechanical improvised when installing because the front pieces didn't attach to the frame of my beach cruiser but they would reach up under my seat where I have a Petego Cycleash Universal Bicycle Dog Leash installed.
customer_reviews.author: Need More Stuff

customer_reviews.title: So easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was a great product. All of the pieces were easily packed. The parts went together well and had enough movement to allow easy fit and install. I highly recommend this if you need a new rack for the back of your bike!
customer_reviews.author: LoganTop Contributor: Action Figures

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Never had a rack before. This has added a ton of flexibility to my bike using paracord, bungees, and velcro. Also got the Ibera panniers--still looking forward to using them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. V.

customer_reviews.title: Great rack for the price-point!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the rear of my Surly Troll for bike-packing and rail trail touring with my son. It's not the lightest rack in the world,but it does seem very well made,sturdy and was easily installed/adjusted to fit my bike (I also installed it on an old Trek mtn bike to see how it fit,it fit it fine as well,for comparison),and holds my panniers securely to the bike,and was easy to strap our tent,ground cloth,and my sleeping bag and pad to the top width-ways. I would buy another,and would recommend it to a friend :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rack with Farily Ease of Install
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is good quality. Feels solid and is very sturdy when installed correctly. I suggest using all the mounts to ensure a solid feel. The front mounts didnt fit the way they were supposed to for my bike but i used them on the outside of the frame to attach the front and it worked. I tie strapped a milk crate to it and carried ice, jackets, and backpacks for Burning Man and it worked great. Fits perfect for a milk crate.
customer_reviews.author: JDC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with older bike
customer_reviews.text: Directions hard to follow; required special tools, did not work with bike (older street bike which does have mounting points for a rack)
customer_reviews.author: Novium

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I'm picky about how well made products are, and this rack met my expectations. It's very strong when installed. I also bought their clip on top rack baggage, and it's also really nice. My bike is 26", and it took the smallest setting on the hardware. This rack is made for 26" and larger bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on my KMX recumbent tricycle, it has ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my KMX recumbent tricycle, it has two wheels in front and one in the rear.The top front connection bars spin and slide in and out so you can connect them at any angle.Bottom two connection points adjust slightly in length.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Rack
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and adaptable! Love using this rack to carry small things back and forth. Hoping to attach bags to it soon!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fusco

customer_reviews.title: Tricky
customer_reviews.text: Had to play around with mounting this thing. It's kind of tricky to put on and the instructions are vague with how the anchor arms should be positioned, but I figured it out after removing the seat, mounting the rack, and putting the seat back on. Other than that, it's decent.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: A great addition
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to put my extra stuff on the rack rather than on my back. Looks great on my bike and I would gladly recommend it to others. Easy to attach and remove.
customer_reviews.author: Scriptman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect item
customer_reviews.text: This rack fit my hybrid bicycle almost perfect! It is sturdy, the only issue was I had to go get a next size larger screw for my lower hub at the tire. Lowe's had it, 6 mm x 1 button head screw, qnty. - 2. Installing alone to the frame under the seat took me several times, as I was doing it alone, but once in, it is on tight.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Dobro

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust to get a good fit on the bike.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say anything about durability yet, but it appears sturdy and well made. Very easy to install and adjust to fit bike (Specialized Alibi). I bent the front stays slightly for a better fit to the frame and purchased some longer 5mm bolts and washers. 5 stars based on fit, finish, and design if it had come with longer mounting screws.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 20 minutes to install on my Cannondale bike.Fits great and i give two thumbs up on this bike rake.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Beaver

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and is very secure and solid, I have been using a dry bag securely tied down with bungie cords but will be ordering the clip in trunk bag this week. I believe then it will be perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: JustTom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I own a professional dog training kennel, and I bought this rack to carry supplies when I'm exercising dogs. It's a solid piece of equipment, and it is priced very reasonably. I don't have much experience with bicycle racks, so I'm not an expert by any means, but this rack is very sturdy and has met all of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Stonnie Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Nice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mount onto my DiamondBack mountain/commuter bike. I like that I can hang bulky heavy milk crates of power tools off the sides without worrying. (What I got it for) Probably works great for normal bags too. Hardware included, I ended up zip tie-ing my fender to the rack though, but that was more of a fender problem than a rack problem. Does what it's supposed to, and doesn't weigh too much.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Forrester

customer_reviews.title: It works great if I used it along with
customer_reviews.text: It works great when used along with: Sunlite Bicycle Monostay Adapter  I have a hybrid 700c Schwinn bike which is hard to fit with bike racks. It took me about 30 minutes to setup both items. It's very sturdy and is well worth buying both items.
customer_reviews.author: David Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack, esecially for Iberia accessories
customer_reviews.text: very adaptable to Iberia snap on accessories and/or random stuff to carry. Lots of places to hook on to. Width is more than adequate and proportional for most bikes
customer_reviews.author: sdjer

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable rack
customer_reviews.text: Worked out very well for my bike. It turns out I only had to slide the top rails out all the way and attach them (by bike already had the attachment points soldered on). The vertical was just fine out of the box. I bought this with the Ibera trunk bag and it has been a winning combo. I took off one star because the screws are soft. I almost stripped out their heads (where the socket wrench fits) just attaching them. But, other than that it is a very nice rack.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Jim

customer_reviews.title: Superb rack  and value
customer_reviews.text: Have installed two of these, one on a smallish hybrid and one a 52cm frame road bike. Very adaptable to different size bikes, easy to adjust rack to horizontal. Very stiff and sturdy. Lower rails allow panniers to sit far enough back for excellent heel clearance. Looks strong enough for a cross country heavily loaded tour, at 1/4 the price of comparable racks for more prestigious manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Beland

product_meta.title: Ibera Bike Rack - Bicycle Touring Carrier Plus+ for Non-Disc Brake Mount, Frame-Mounted for Heavier Top & Side Loads, Height Adjustable for 26"-29" Frames
product_meta.description:
Carries up to 25 kg (55 lb), Reflector attachable, TIG-welded, heat-treated, anodized aluminum. Compatible with Ibera trunk bags, side Pannier bags and planet-friendly reusable bags (PakRak IB-BA9, IB-BA11, IB-BA14, IB-BA15, IB-BA16, IB-BA18, IB-BA19, IB-BA20). 
Specifications: 
Material 
Durable lightweight heat-treated aluminum 

Features 
Plus+ allows Ibera trunk bags and planet-friendly reusable bags (IB-BA1, IB-BA14, IB-BA15, IB-BA18, IB-BA19) to be mounted with Ibera panniers simultaneously (IB-BA4, IB-BA9, IB-BA16, IB-BA20) 
Also compatible with strap-attached bags and panniers. 

Mount Type 
Frame-mounted for heavier top and side loads 
Quick-release bag mounting system (bags not included) 

Dimensions 
15.5" x 6.0" x 14-15" (top shelf is 5.5" in width) 
Adjustable height 
Fits most 26" and 700c frames 

Load weight 
Carries up to 55 lb (25kg) 

Rack weight 
1.68 lbs / 760g
feature_bullets: Frame-mounted for heavier top and side loads
Adjustable to fit most 26–29 inch bicycle frames can carry upto 25 kg (55 lb)
Allow to use IBERA Trunk bags (IB-BA11, IB-BA14, IB-BA15, IB-BA22) and most universal strap-attached panniers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
